Summary: Don't trust the pics on their website.  My room was pretty big, cavernous, two queen beds, but that's about it.  When you walk into the room you literally walk into a closet.  Sparse seating.  They could've put a Larger table instead of a small desk.  On one wall there were 4 electrical outlets.  Furniture looked like they went to good will and purchase it.    Now to the bathroom.  No counter space for the size of the bathroom.  Behind the toilet it looked liked they didn’t finish the base boards.  The toilet paper holder was rusted.  The shower needs to be fixed.  You pull the thing to get the shower going but the spigot was spouting out more water than the shower itself. Water didn’t drain fast enough.   Paint was coming off the ceiling above the beds.  Looked like the ceiling

I've worked in hospitality for years and years and this is definitely just a low end, low cost property.   My sister and I had been driving all night and wanted to see if we could check in early just to get off our feet for a little and lie down. I tried knowing that it would be unlikely given my time in the industry. I tried and to no avail, we left to get some coffee down the street. I came back asking if they could at least hold my luggage so that we weren't driving around everywhere with our belongings. The front desk agent came around the desk (no shoes on) to tell us he had nowhere to hold our luggage. I asked if I could cancel with no charge so that I can find another location that might let us check in early and he went back to computer and said he could check us in.

This place boost that is 3 stars or better not true shower broke we were unable to shower when they did fix it we had to use the ice bucket to pour water over his to get a shower it doesn't come out hardly at all any water if you want ice you have to see the manager he's got to get a remote control to turn the ice on for you the maid won't even fold the blankets after you use them after housekeeping lousy service lousy place

Summary Heading: Also known as Buena Vista Inn. Cheap clean room near Disney and walk to Knotts.
Summary: We stayed here after a full day at Disneyland. The Uber from the park to the hotel was pretty cheap around $10. We checked in in very late, and the man at the night window was so friendly, and had us sorted in about a minute. (There is a Rallys just up the road for a quick late night bite too) The room was comfortable and clean, and even though the exterior looked a little sketchy, it was actually fine. Check out was fast and easy as well. I've stayed in far worse Budget hotels in this area, and this one is OK.

Summary Heading: Good value for a cheap hotel
Summary: don't expect a 4star hotel and you wont be disappointed.  It is a very basic property, could use a full renovation, but it is priced affordably and is conveniently located to visit knotts berry farm and for decent shopping. If you want fancier, go spend 40 bucks more a night and get a fancier one, but for the price, its a decently cheap place so i give it 4/5 for being exactly as advertised and meeting our needs.
Room tip: book direct with the hotel so you can ask for a renovated room, click the helpful button if you...

Summary: This is a very conveniently located property in Anaheim Buena Park, however the rooms are old fashioned and they need maintenance work. To top it all, my room was infested with roaches. I don’t recommend this property to anyone. I am traveling on a business trip therefore I am stuck in this place for the night but it was an absolutely unfortunate and negative experience.

We stayed with family and booked two rooms.  The location was within walking distance to Knotts Berry Farm.  The room was clean,  but the bed was very uncomfortable! Like sleeping on a concrete slab.  True, you can hear everything that happens next door and outside.  There is also a Dominoes Pizza 500 feet away in case you get hungry.

When we stayed hotel was being renovated. Room was clean had new carpet, new tile in bathroom. The bathroom door had serious damage to it with a bad repair job. Sink drained really slowly because the drain pipe was done wrong. The furniture needs to be updated and the King mattress needs to be replaced seriously it was very lumpy and uncomfortable no good to sleep on. Slept on love seat instead. I ended up buying a comforter and doubled it up to put padding so I could sleep. The refrigerator needs to be replaced too. A very basic room for the price. The older lady that checked me could use some people skills she was pretty rude.

Although this hotel needs renovating. My room was clean and not very noisy at all. The owners daughter was very helpful when I checked in and was very nice. This place is good if you are looking for hotels that are near stores such as Walmart, mechanic shop, clothing stores. Then this is the hotel.
Room tip: First floor but beware of the guys with the cluttered room.

Summary Heading: OK place, but feels very cheap
Summary: Nothing terrible wrong with this place: clean enough, friendly enough service, comfortable enough bed. However, it has "cheap" written all over. Walking in the room with white socks will reveal a very dirty carpet, paint job on the walls is horrible, decoration is extremely sad. I cannot but feel that with a little more money rooms could look a lot better.  Breakfast was appalling, a few bad quality pastries, OJ and coffee that you pick up from reception an take to your room. I ended up buying my own breakfast, as I need a good start of the day.  Pretty decent wi-fi

That room smelling and you can here every word from your nighboor I don't stand enymore there and bathroom was time for renovation that price was to high for that place so if you what stand in this area chech after another hotel to stay in .there coffeemaker was empty no chocolate or coffe sorry never again

I decided to stay here for a night with my girlfriend since we was going to do some heavy drinking this specific night , I live about 24 miles away so decided it was for the best ...  The price was reasonable, the service was quick as they was expecting my arrival  The biggest downside was the appearance of the room it really needs some work done I'm glad I just stayed for a night & to top it off I got a complaint on my noise level at 11:30 pm on a Saturday night

Gave it a try and pleasantly surprised. Comfortable large room with fresh paint, new flat screen and loaded with amenities. Very clean and friendly service. Nice area close to all. I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Traveler, We appreciate your positive feedback and taking the time to share your experiences with other travelers. We are pleased to learn that you were happy with your room accommodations and that you will consider returning.  We look forward to seeing you in the future! Sincerely, Management

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days and we loved it. The front desk staff was super sweet, and helped us with any problem we had. Fridge and microwave were in our room so that was very convenient. It was close by to all of the places we needed to go, and was walking distance to a Wal-Mart and target for last minute needs. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for your positive review of our hotel and for sharing your constructive comments with other travelers. We do take pride in our property and we are so happy that you noticed our many amenities, our friendly staff and our excellent location.   We do value you as our guest and look forward to your return again in the future.  Sincerely,  Management

Summary: Well, I stayed a week in this motel. Didn't have a very warm welcoming when i got there...  I was here for business, so I didn't spend much time in my room, but the reason I choose this motel is that it wasn't expensive and close to the place I had to go everyday.  About the room.  Spacious, which is good. Beds were cool too, BUT ! Walls are like cigarette paper ! I could listen to all the discussions my neighbors had every nights. Pretty annoying.  But, if you have the chance to be in a room without noisy neighbors, and if you're not depressed (lol) the place is very very quiet. There's nothing around.  Goodies : Free Wifi, fridge, microwave, free parking. Beverage dispenser for $1.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest, Thank you for sharing the positive aspects of your stay while also informing us of your displeasure.  We are pleased to learn that you were happy with your week long stay at our motel while on business and that you enjoyed our many amenities. We value all remarks, as they help us improve. We look forward to your return.   Sincerely, Management

Summary: We decided to leave for Disneyland a day earlier...needed a place to stay because our hotel for the following day was all booked. This seemed like a reasonable option....uhh no! I have been told not to book hotels outside of the Anaheim area and now I know why.   *Prostitue in from of hotel, her "manager" watching from the second story  *rooms were filthy....beyond dirty  The only plus side; we were able to cancel and get a refund because the manager could see this was no place for kids.   This seems like an hour rental type place.   Stay away!

So, if I was desperate and only had $50 to my name I would stay here again but other than that, it's a no. First off, I was supposed to have a free room upgrade and when I called to ask about it (twice) I spoke with 2 different Middle Eastern men. Neither one of them seemed interested in giving me the upgrade and said there was "only 1" room that met the upgrade criteria and it would probably be taken when I got there. Anyway, when I went to check in there was an American guy at the front and he gave me the room upgrade with no problem. At first the room seemed ok until I started noticing the dirty fork on the couch, the hot cheeto on the floor and the stained sheets. I went to the bathroom twice and the knob on the toilet broke. It just kept spinning and spinning! I tried to

Went thru Expedia for this "room" they shouldn't advertise this at all because it's actually an apt bldg!!! People live upstairs.  Beds were concrete hard, people that lived above us were running back  and forth or moving furniture! Was advertised as a full breakfast, Not even close. Danish and donuts don't count as a breakfast. No wifi unless you want to pay $10 a nite! Parking is for small cars only! The owners were nice but the establishment gets a big fat zero from me. And one last thing, after paying $150 for the nite, they have the odasity to leave a tip envelope!! Couldn't believe ie!!!

I had to change rooms because the air conditioner stopped working after the fifth day, but both rooms where horrible. The floors made my feet black, there were stains on the beds and floors and ceilings, the water temperature is inconsistent, and the pool was filled with gravel. The refrigerator in the second room didn't work. Not to mention the staff are not friendly. I had a free room upgrade and he told me he had no more rooms even though there weren't many people staying there so he totally lied. I even peeked into some of the better rooms to check and no one was there. Completely bad experience.

Summary Heading: Absolutely Horrifying... RUN AWAY FROM THIS DUMP!!!
Summary: This is the worst hotel I have EVER stayed at. I booked our room on the corporate website and paid for the room in full because I opted for the advance purchase rate. I printed out the conformation and receipt. We went to check in at about 645pm and were told that we would have to pay AGAIN. The clerk told us that we had to pay for the room before we could get in it. When I showed him my paperwork and explained that I had paid for the room already, he said that wasnt good enough and that it "wasnt true" since they "never take prepayments". So, needless to say, I became a little upset and called corporate to try to figure out what to do. I spoke with 4 different representatives over the course of 2 hours. All of the representatives saw in the reservation where we had prepaid  Two

Summary Heading: Great value, friendly service--would stay here again
Summary: My family of six stayed here for a week for a Disneyland trip.  I was very happy with the room and service for the price.  Pro: *  Very friendly staff.  The family running the hotel was always friendly and helpful when asked about other things to do than Disneyland.  I felt very welcome when speaking with them *  Room was large (with 2nd bedroom separated by a door) and clean. *  Within walking distance of Disneyland  Con: *  The travel website we book through said the hotel was right across the street from Disneyland.  You actually have to walk about 20 minutes--too far to come back to the hotel mid-day. *  Beds were pretty uncomfortable
Soap scum/mold on the shower curtain and tub!!!! Need I say more!!!

Summary Heading: Enjoyed my stay, will return next years
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. I would recommend to people traveling with family family. Walking distance to Disney and also Garden Walk is right next door.

This is an old hotel, probably one of the originals from the old days.  It was the perfect place for a budget vacation. What it lacked it special services it gained in customer service. The staff was spectacular. They were helpful and very friendly. The beds were hard but the room was very clean. If you're looking for a big continental breakfast look elsewhere; it was very basic danish, coffee and apples but it hit the spot for a quick run. It's really only maybe a 10 min walk to the park but if you have children or have a disability there is a shuttle a couple of hotels down that runs every 20 min. I'd definently stay there again.

We read some bad reviews, but were pleasantly surprised!  The room was clean and in good order. No insects of any kind.  The king bed was firm.  The bathroom was well kept.  Some patched holes in the walls were being repaired.  Overall, this hotel was nice.  The elevator worked well.  The maids were hospitable.  I would go there agian!

To be fair, we did not pay for this stay at the Budget Value Inn in Anaheim.  We actually used a free "vacation certificate" that we received after going to a timeshare presentation.  The company that issued the hotel stay was Casablanca Express.  They had offered me an option to upgrade to a better hotel for extra money, but we figured we could rough it a couple of nights while we visited Disneyland so we declined and stuck with the free stay.  The hotel is actually located a couple of blocks from Knott's Berry Farm and a 10 minute drive from Disneyland.  When I checked in, I knew I really WAS roughing it.  I saw a bug skit across the bathroom floor when I turned the light on, so I decided we'd leave the bathroom light on all night "just in case" and I put my luggage up on the
Good facilities for a large family.  Extremely helpful staff.  However, quite a distance to Disneyland & poor transport links.  Expect to pay $8 taxi fare each way or wait a long time for buses.

There were cigarette burns in the blankets, and sheets (in our non-smoking room).  Sticky bathroom floors, black mold around the bathtub, and peeling paint in the bathroom.  As mentioned in another review no lightbulbs (one of three lightbulbs worked in the main room).  The breakfast consists of coffee and prewrapped pastries that you buy in the grocery store and no place to sit and eat.  We also did not have enough towels.  It doesn't look like they vacummed because a whole oreo cookie was found on the floor.  Just disgusting!  Worth the extra money to go elsewhere.

We were told this was comparable to a Howard Johnson's but it definitely did not compare. Having stayed in a variety of places (overseas and in U.S.), staying everywhere from being hikers/no-tent campers to guests in 5-star hotels, and everything in between, this place was simply filthy and rundown. After check-in & visiting the room, we had to ask for all of our towels, the bathroom counters were left with hair and spots of something sticky on them, the rug had not been vacuumed, the entertainment center had a broken drawer front laying half on the floor, bathroom fixtures that had been broken and badly "repaired", one very small shampoo foil packet for two people to use, we even had to ask for two lightbulbs as there were none in the lamps! We have never stayed in such a

This hotel is a great value for the money. You get a real studio apartment with full kitchen and bath, and a small living area with fold-out couch and fireplace (the bed is at back of room), for a really nice price. Light breakfast and dinner are complimentary. You can park your car right outside but the feel of the place is more like an apartment complex than a hotel. I often stay in big hotels but in Anaheim this is one of my favorite places to stay because you can really settle in here and relax. Room is not luxurious but comfortable.  Cleaning staff very good. Only improvement would be more pillows and towels.
